required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Standardised Enteral Feeding in Infants With Duct Dependant Lesions; a Randomised Control Trial.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Standardised vs Local Preoperative Enteral Feeding Practice on the Incidence of NEC in Infants With Duct Dependent Lesions: a Randomised Control Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Princess Anna Mazowiecka Hospital, Warsaw, Poland

clinical_study.source: Princess Anna Mazowiecka Hospital, Warsaw, Poland

brief_summary.textblock: We are registering a multicenter randomised controlled trial to assess whether standardised enteral feeding in newborns with duct dependenty congenital heart disease decreases the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC). We plan to include a total 384 infants. The study will be carried out in three level III hospitals in Poland. The primary end will be NEC and/or death. Secondary end points include weight gain, hospital length of stay, time required to reach full feeding.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of final diagnosis of necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC).
primary_outcome.description: Number of infants diagnosed with NEC.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Median change from baseline within 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of number of interrupted feedings
Final median value of Vasoactive support
Median change from baseline of protein intake
Median change from baseline of caloric intake
Proportion of final value of days required to reach full enteral feeding
Proportion of final value of days on mechanical ventilation
Proportion of final value of days required to regain birth weight
Median change from baseline of breastfeeding of > 50%
Proportion of culture proven late onset sepsis

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of final value of age at transfer

arm_group.description: Patients will receive enteral feeding based on the practice of the leading physician.

Infants will receive enteral feeding based on the following protocol. Enteral nutrition Minimal enteral nutrition (MEN) will begin within 72 hours life at 10 to 20. mL/kg/day, via bolus gravity breast milk/donor human milk. MEN will not be included in the caloric goals. Advancements in feeding will be set at 20-30 mL/kg/day, but not more than 10ml per feeding portion to reach a goal of 150ml/kg/day, but not than 120ml/kg/day cases of fluid restriction). The goal will be to reach an overall daily caloric intake of minimum 100kcal/kg/d.

intervention.intervention_name: enteral feeding as per predefined protocol
intervention.description: Infants will receive enteral feeding based on the following protocol. Enteral nutrition Minimal enteral nutrition (MEN) will begin within 72 hours life at 10 to 20. mL/kg/day, via bolus gravity breast milk/donor human milk. MEN will not be included in the caloric goals. Advancements in feeding will be set at 20-30 mL/kg/day, but not more than 10ml per feeding portion to reach a goal of 150ml/kg/day, but not than 120ml/kg/day cases of fluid restriction). The goal will be to reach an overall daily caloric intake of minimum 100kcal/kg/d.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Duct dependent congenital heart disease
2. Term infants
3. Parental/legal guardian consent
Exclusion criteria:
1. Potential contradictions to early central feeding
2. Feeding intolerance
3. Hemodynamic instability
4. Death
5. > 50% formula based enteral feeding
6. Birth weight less than 2500g

facility.name: Department of Neonatology and Neonatal Intensive Care Warsaw Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Princess Anna Mazowiecka Hospital, Warsaw, Poland
